newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Irish business told to prepare now for the Euro.
newsitem.headline: Irish business told to prepare now for the Euro.

text.p: Irish business must start to prepare now for the introduction of the Euro, the single European currency, Leo O'Donnell, President of the Institute of Chartered Accountants in Ireland said on Wednesday.
Speaking to a luncheon meeting, O'Donnell said the practical implications for businesses of the changeover needed to be addressed at an early stage.

"The new currency will affect every business and individual, impacting on our cash registers and computer systems, on pricing policy, sales and purchase contracts, invoicing, accounting records...and direct and indirect taxation," said O'Donnell.

He said the ICAI is preparing a programme for all its members on the practical and operational issues involved in the move to the Euro so that they in turn can assist business in preparing for the change.
